Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.SegmentToggle Class Reference

Controls the toggling functionality for a specific segment of the patient's model in the hand menu. More...

Inheritance diagram for Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.SegmentToggle:

Public Attributes

GameObject target
 The target GameObject to toggle.
 

Private Member Functions

void OnTriggerEnter (Collider other)
 Called when a collider enters the trigger zone and disables the button to prevent bounce effects.
 
void OnTriggerExit (Collider other)
 Called when a collider exits the trigger zone. The button is enabled, and it calls the method to toggle the target GameObject, then it calls a coroutine to enable the button again.
 
IEnumerator EnableAfterSeconds ()
 Enables the button after a specified delay to mitigate button bounce effects.
 
void executeAction ()
 Toggles the active state of the target GameObject.
 

Private Attributes

bool buttonPressDisabled = false
 Variable stores if the button is currently disabled.
 
float disableTime = 0.1f
 Time the button is disabled after press to mitigate the bounce effect.
 

Detailed Description

Controls the toggling functionality for a specific segment of the patient's model in the hand menu.

void Valve.VR.InteractionSystem.SegmentToggle.OnTriggerExit ( Collider  other)

Called when a collider exits the trigger zone. The button is enabled, and it calls the method to toggle the target GameObject, then it calls a coroutine to enable the button again.
